intro: Basanacantha martinicensis, commonly known as the Martinique spurge, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean islands. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
